definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum

sentences.english: You just opened the door to temptation and let Sloane walk through it ?
sentences.chinese: 你就这样打开了诱惑之门让斯隆大摇大摆了走了进去？

sentences.english: He was strutting the hall of business when the boss talked to me.
sentences.chinese: 老板跟我谈话时，他在营业大厅里大摇大摆地走过。

sentences.english: He strutted up and down before the manager.
sentences.chinese: 他在经理面前大摇大摆地走来走去。
他大摇大摆地进了我家。

sentences.english: But the mood in Berlin is not sunny, or swaggering.
sentences.chinese: 但柏林的情绪就没有那么阳光，亦或是大摇大摆了。

sentences.english: They swaggered down the street, hooking on each other.
sentences.chinese: 他们互相挽着手臂大摇大摆地沿着大街走去。

sentences.english: He pranced out of the room in a fury.
sentences.chinese: 盛怒之下大摇大摆走出了房间。

sentences.english: He walked into the malones' flat as bold as brass .
sentences.chinese: 他大摇大摆走进马龙家的一套房间。

sentences.english: He strutted about the street like a gaudy fighting cock.
sentences.chinese: 他在街上大摇大摆地走，像一只绚丽好斗的公鸡。

sentences.english: Obviously the thief had simply walked out this way as bold as brass.
sentences.chinese: 显然贼人是从这里大摇大摆出去的。

sentences.english: What makes you think you can just walk in there and fnd what we need?
sentences.chinese: 你凭什么以为自己能大摇大摆地走进去为所欲为呢？

definition: overt/to make no secret (of one's presence)/grandiose/with great scope

pinyin: shen2 bu4 zhi1 gui3 bu4 jue2

definition: at a stride/taking large steps (while walking)
dull gray/gloomy/dejected/crestfallen/with one's tail between one's legs
to show off one's military strength (idiom); to strut around/to bluff/to bluster
see 悠哉悠哉[you1 zai1 you1 zai1]
striding forward with head high (idiom); to walk with spirited and vigorous step/to strut
to parade oneself ostentatiously about town (idiom)
